involved in several corporate actions. On September 1, 2025, the company announced the signing of a Joint Venture Agreement. Additionally, the company informed the exchange regarding the intimation of the Annual General Meeting date and notice of Book closure on August 29, 2025. The company has also announced dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (275%) was announced on October 28, 2024, with an effective date of November 12, 2024. A final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) was announced on May 7, 2024, with an effective date of September 13, 2024. Furthermore, a bonus issue was announced on December 10, 2024, with an existing ratio of 1:1 and an ex-bonus date of January 31, 2025. The company had a stock split on November 9, 2017, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split to a new face value of Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis on August 26, 2025, indicated a very bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 217.22, Indraprastha Gas has shown positive momentum in today's session, marked by a surge in trading volume and a spot among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Deepak Nitrite shares hit 52-week low; stock declines 1.08%
content: Shares of Deepak Nitrite touched a 52-week low of Rs 1,769.00 on the BSE, with the stock declining 1.08% to Rs 1769.50 in Tuesday's session. The scrip's performance was subdued as it traded close to its new yearly low at 1:32 pm. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In terms of financials, the consolidated revenue for Deepak Nitrite for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,889.88 Crore, compared to Rs 2,179.69 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 112.25 Crore, down from Rs 202.50 Crore in the previous quarter. The company's EPS stood at Rs 8.23 for the quarter-ending June 2025. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 8,281.93 Crore, up from Rs 7,681.83 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 697.37 Crore, down from Rs 810.86 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS stood at Rs 51.12 for the year-ending March 2025. Here is a detailed look at the company’s financial performance:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,166.84 CroreRs 2,032.00 CroreRs 1,903.40 CroreRs 2,179.69 CroreRs 1,889.88 CroreNet ProfitRs 202.53 CroreRs 194.20 CroreRs 98.13 CroreRs 202.50 CroreRs 112.25 CroreEPS14.8514.247.1914.848.23The company's revenue decreased by 12.78 percent in June 2025 compared to June 2024. The net profit also decreased by 44.58 percent in June 2025 compared to June 2024.Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,359.75 CroreRs 6,802.19 CroreRs 7,972.06 CroreRs 7,681.83 CroreRs 8,281.93 CroreNet ProfitRs 775.81 CroreRs 1,066.64 CroreRs 852.00 CroreRs 810.86 CroreRs 697.37 CroreEPS56.8878.2062.4659.4551.12BVPS172.04244.75299.85353.57395.06ROE33.0631.9520.8316.9012.93Debt to Equity0.250.090.010.050.22The revenue increased by 7.81 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. The net profit decreased by 14.00 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Deepak Nitrite announced a final dividend of Rs 7.50 per share, with an effective date of August 4, 2025. The company had also announced a bonus issue on May 2, 2014, with an existing ratio of 1:1. A stock split was announced on May 2, 2014, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 26, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment for Deepak Nitrite. With the stock hitting its 52-week low, Deepak Nitrite faces selling pressure amid overall bearish sentiment.

title: S.P. Apparels AGM Approves Resolutions, Dividend Declaration
content: S.P. Apparels Limited (SPAL.BO) convened its 20th Annual General Meeting (AGM) on September 1, 2025, announcing shareholder approval for key resolutions. These included the adoption of audited FY25 financials and dividend declaration, according to a company release. The following resolutions were approved by shareholders: Adoption of audited standalone and consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2025. Declaration of dividend on equity shares. Re-appointment of Mr. S Chenduran as a director. Appointment of MDS & Associates LLP as secretarial auditors. Re-appointment of Mr. Sundararajan Perumal Mudaliar as Chairman and Managing Director. Re-appointment of Mrs. Lakshmi Priya as an Independent Director. Re-appointment of Mr. C.R. Rajagopal as an Independent Director. Details of the resolutions and voting outcomes are presented below: Item No. 1: Adoption of Audited Financial StatementsParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received702,09,58,660-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes702,09,58,660100.00Assent682,01,11,84995.96Dissent28,46,8114.04 Note: 2 shareholders holding 31,018 equity shares abstained from voting. 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares partially voted in favor of the resolution for 13 equity shares and abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The resolution for adopting audited financials passed as an ordinary resolution. Item No. 2: Declaration of Dividend on Equity SharesParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent712,09,89,677100.00Dissent110.00 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares partially voted in favor of the resolution for 13 equity shares and abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The dividend declaration was approved as an ordinary resolution. Item No. 3: Re-appointment of Mr. S Chenduran as DirectorParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent702,09,74,93099.93Dissent214,7480.07 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares partially voted for the resolution for 13 equity shares and abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The re-appointment of Mr. S Chenduran as Director was approved as an ordinary resolution. Item No. 4: Appointment of MDS & Associates LLP as Secretarial AuditorsParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent712,09,89,677100.00Dissent110.00 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares have partially voted in favour of the resolution for 13 equity shares and partially abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The appointment of MDS & Associates LLP as Secretarial Auditors was approved as an ordinary resolution. Item No. 5: Re-appointment of Mr. Sundararajan Perumal Mudaliar as Chairman and Managing DirectorParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent712,09,89,677100.00Dissent110.00 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares have partially voted in favour of the resolution for 13 equity shares and partially abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The re-appointment of Mr. Sundararajan Perumal Mudaliar as Chairman and Managing Director was passed as a special resolution. Item No. 6: Re-appointment of Mrs. Lakshmi Priya as an Independent DirectorParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent662,01,20,92795.86Dissent68,68,7514.14 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares have partially voted in favour of the resolution for 13 equity shares and partially abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The resolution for the re-appointment of Mrs. Lakshmi Priya as an Independent Director was passed as a special resolution. Item No. 7: Re-appointment of Mr. C.R. Rajagopal as an Independent DirectorParticularsNo. of E-VotesNo. of SharesPercentage to Valid VotesTotal E-Votes Received722,09,89,678-Less: Invalid votes00-Net Valid E-Votes722,09,89,678100.00Assent662,01,20,92795.86Dissent68,68,7514.14 Note: 4 shareholders holding 1,08,484 equity shares have partially voted in favour of the resolution for 13 equity shares and partially abstained from voting for 1,08,471 equity shares. The re-appointment of Mr. C.R. Rajagopal as an Independent Director was passed as a special resolution. According to the scrutinizer's report, all resolutions from Item No. 1 to Item No. 7 were approved by shareholders with the requisite majority. title: Trident to Invest ₹250 Crore in Trident Global Corp Limited
content: Trident Ltd. (TRIDENT) Board Approves ₹250 Crore Investment in Trident Global Corp Limited (TGCL) Trident Limited's board has greenlit an investment of up to ₹250 crore in the equity shares of Trident Global Corp Limited (TGCL), a public limited company. The investment will occur in one or more tranches and is subject to regulatory approvals. The strategic acquisition is aimed at providing Trident immediate entry into the domestic brand market. The company plans to utilize existing manufacturing capabilities, enhance brand equity, and establish itself as a multi-category home solutions provider. TGCL has an established reputation as a trusted brand both in India and internationally. The Board of Directors has delegated oversight of the investment to the Financial Management Committee. Details Trident Global Corp Limited (TGCL) ₹5.11 Crore ₹481 Crore Yes To acquire a strategic equity stake in TGCL to secure immediate access to the domestic brand market, leverage existing Company’s manufacturing for select categories, strengthen brand equity, and position the Company as a multi-category home solutions provider under the Trident umbrella. TGCL has established itself as a trusted brand in both domestic and international markets. The Board approved investment in Trident Global Corp Limited, a Public Limited Company upto INR 250 crore from time to time in one or more tranche(s). 30.42% shareholding acquired by Associate Company, total 2,23,21,428 Equity Shares acquired. Background of Trident Global Corp Limited TGCL, incorporated on 01-09-2011, has an established e-commerce presence, growing retail footprint, strong domestic brand recall, and sourcing flexibility enabling a complete product range. It specializes in premium products such as towels, bed sheets, and TOB (Towel-on-Bath) items, with a presence across 6,000+ retail outlets nationwide. TurnoverParticularsFY2022-23FY2023-24FY2024-25Turnover₹349 Crore₹475 Crore₹481 CroreThe Board Meeting commenced at 11:30 A.M. IST and concluded at 12:36 P.M. IST.

title: Nalco, DLF, other metal and real estate stocks rise up to 5%: Fed rate cut hopes, 4 other reasons behind rally
content: The shares of metal and real estate companies surged on September 2, buoyed by multiple factors. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the two sectoral indices into the green, leading gains on the market today. The Nifty Metal index rose 1.3 percent to hover around 9,426, and the Nifty Realty index gained 1.33 percent to 891.50, as seen at 12.10 pm. Here are 5 possible triggers for the sharp rise in the stocks: US Fed rate cut hopes: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on August 22 said that the weak job market may soon force the American central bank to cut interest rates. "Downside risks to employment are rising," according to Powell's remarks at the Jackson Hole Economic Policy Symposium. Most investors now expect a 25-basis-point Fed rate cut during its upcoming meeting which is scheduled between September 16 and September 17. A rate cut in the US could reduce borrowing costs for foreign investors, encouraging them to invest in higher growth markets in India. This boosts real estate and metal stocks. Additionally, investors expect the RBI to follow Fed in the pursuit of a rate cut, if any. This too can positively impact the stocks. GST reforms: The GST Council, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, is slated to meet in New Delhi on September 3-4 to deliberate on the Centre's proposal for a simplified two-rate structure of 5 percent and 18 percent. According to market experts, this simplicity in the tax structure will reduce the cost of developers and benefit homebuyers. Pradeep Aggarwal, Founder & Chairman, Signature Global (India) Ltd said that housing sector stands to benefit from these reforms, as moving to a two-slab structure will not only make GST compliance easier for real estate developers, but also help rationalise input costs, improve cash flows and eventually reduce the cost of homes for buyers. Strong Q1 GDP numbers: Indian economy grew 7.8 percent in the April-June quarter of the ongoing financial year. This is the highest growth recorded in five consecutive quarters, beating economists' estimates. Gross domestic product (GDP) topped both the RBI's 6.5 percent projection and the 6.6 percent median recorded in a Moneycontrol poll. The GDP growth was also stronger than the 7.4 percent rate recorded in the preceding three months (Q4 FY25) and 6.5 percent recorded a year earlier (Q1 FY25). The strong GDP numbers may have spurred confidence in Indian economy's growth, which in turn boosted the real estate and metal stocks. Weak dollar: The US dollar is hovering near a multi-month low. Trump's appointments to the Fed are likely to further weigh on the dollar, according to DBS. "Already, the labour market is softening, and Chair Powell has signalled the possibility of rate cuts at Jackson Hole," the analysts wrote. "This means that the overvalued USD could ease again as markets anticipate coming Fed rate cuts." A weaker dollar improves global demand for commodities, like metals, which in turn benefits Indian metal companies through higher export opportunities and better pricing. China aims to cut steel output: China aims to cut steel production between 2025 and 2026, according to an official document reviewed by Reuters. The country's move aims to tackle overcapacity that has hit prices significantly. Reduced steel output from China will reduce dumping of cheap metals into the Indian market, which in turn will benefit the Indian metal companies. On the metal index, National Aluminium Company (NALCO) shares gained nearly 5 percent to emerge as the top gainer. NMDC shares followed, rising nearly 4 percent. Hindustan Copper, Steel Authority of India (SAIL), Tata Steel, APL Apollo Tubes, Hindustan Zinc and JSW Steel shares gained up to 3 percent. On the real estate index, Phoenix Mills shares gained 3.5 percent to trade at Rs 1,570 apiece and emerge as the top gainer. Anant Raj and DLF shares jumped up to 3 percent. Godrej Properties, Oberoi Realty and Raymond shares gained nearly 2 percent each. "Real estate and metal stocks have emerged as notable gainers after facing pressure in earlier months. The combination of infrastructure-led demand growth, record commercial real estate performance, and favourable GST rate cut expectation is presently leading both sectors outperformance," said Puneet Singhania, Director at Master Trust Group. GST reforms and rate cuts together can spur growth by lowering compliance costs, improving efficiency, and boosting affordability, said Pranay Aggarwal, Director and CEO of Stoxkart. "Reduced GST on housing or construction inputs supports real estate demand, while cheaper financing from rate cuts aids both homebuyers and capital-intensive industries like metals. These measures enhance investment, stimulate domestic demand, and strengthen overall market sentiment," he added. India’s real estate sector is in a structural upcycle, with housing sales in the top seven cities crossing 180,000 units in H1 2025, the highest in 15 years, said Jickson Sajee Research Analyst, INVasset PMS. "With private equity inflows exceeding $3.5 billion in H1, the sector is attracting capital, while large, disciplined developers are consolidating market share," Sajee added. Indian metal firms are countering through integration, efficiency, and green steel investments, keeping medium-term prospects strong despite near-term volatility, Sajee further said. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates (With inputs from Reuters) Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Reduced steel output from China will reduce dumping of cheap metals into the Indian market, which in turn will benefit the Indian metal companies.
summary_luhn: Reduced steel output from China will reduce dumping of cheap metals into the Indian market, which in turn will benefit the Indian metal companies.
summary_lsa: The combination of infrastructure-led demand growth, record commercial real estate performance, and favourable GST rate cut expectation is presently leading both sectors outperformance," said Puneet Singhania, Director at Master Trust Group.
summary_textrank: Here are 5 possible triggers for the sharp rise in the stocks: US Fed rate cut hopes: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on August 22 said that the weak job market may soon force the American central bank to cut interest rates.

title: Nestle India shares rise 2.01% in Tuesday's session
content: Nestle India shares gained 2.01% to trade at Rs 1,198 at 12:39 pm on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Nestle India's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown fluctuations. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 4,813.95 Crore, which increased to Rs 5,104.00 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It then decreased to Rs 4,779.73 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, before increasing to Rs 5,503.88 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The latest revenue figure for the quarter-ending June 2025 stands at Rs 5,096.16 Crore. The net profit followed a similar trend. It was Rs 746.60 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024, increased to Rs 903.21 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024, decreased to Rs 695.82 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024, and then rose to Rs 885.88 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 is Rs 659.23 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) also varied, with Rs 7.74 for June 2024, Rs 9.33 for September 2024, Rs 7.14 for December 2024, Rs 9.06 for March 2025, and Rs 6.71 for June 2025. Nestle India's consolidated yearly financial performance reveals the following:Heading20242025RevenueRs 24,393.89 CroreRs 20,201.56 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,932.84 CroreRs 3,231.54 CroreEPSRs 40.79Rs 33.27BVPSRs 34.65Rs 41.59ROE117.7179.98Debt to Equity0.010.19The yearly revenue saw a decrease from Rs 24,393.89 Crore in 2024 to Rs 20,201.56 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit decreased from Rs 3,932.84 Crore in 2024 to Rs 3,231.54 Crore in 2025. EPS also declined from Rs 40.79 in 2024 to Rs 33.27 in 2025. However, the book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 34.65 in 2024 to Rs 41.59 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) decreased from 117.71 in 2024 to 79.98 in 2025, and the debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.01 in 2024 to 0.19 in 2025. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales decreasing from Rs 24,393 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 20,201 Crore in March 2025. Other income decreased from Rs 147 Crore to Rs 58 Crore, leading to a decrease in total income from Rs 24,541 Crore to Rs 20,260 Crore. Total expenditure decreased from Rs 19,107 Crore to Rs 15,784 Crore, and EBIT decreased from Rs 5,434 Crore to Rs 4,476 Crore. Interest decreased slightly from Rs 145 Crore to Rs 136 Crore, and tax decreased from Rs 1,356 Crore to Rs 1,108 Crore. Consequently, net profit decreased from Rs 3,932 Crore to Rs 3,231 Crore. The consolidated quarterly income statement highlights the following (all figures in Crore):ParticularsJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales5,0965,5034,7795,1044,813Other Income484639Total Income5,1005,5124,7845,1104,853Total Expenditure4,1524,2703,8273,8743,812EBIT9471,2429561,2361,040Interest4637343231Tax241318226300262Net Profit659885695903746The cash flow statement indicates that net cash flow decreased from -Rs 197 Crore in March 2024 to -Rs 722 Crore in March 2025. The balance sheet shows that total liabilities increased from Rs 10,523 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 12,193 Crore in March 2025, and total assets also increased from Rs 10,523 Crore to Rs 12,193 Crore during the same period. Key financial ratios for Nestle India show a P/E ratio of 33.83 and a P/B ratio of 54.12 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.19 as of the year-ending March 2025. Nestle India announced a bonus issue of 1:1, with the ex-bonus date as August 8, 2025, and the record date as August 8, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on October 19, 2023, with the ex-split date and record date on January 5, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 2, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,198.00, Nestle India has seen a rise during today's session.

title: Silver's record rally past $40 has rubbed off on shares of key suppliers like Hindustan Zinc
content: For the first time since 2011, international silver prices are above $40 per ounce, tracking renewed investor interest in precious metals, with the extended run sparking interest in shares of suppliers and clean energy companies. Last month alone, silver prices surged over 10 percent, and the continued rally has rubbed off on the shares of Indian companies engaged in related businesses such as Hindustan Zinc, Vedanta and Goldiam International, anticipating earnings boost from a surge in industrial as well as investor demand. Shares of Hindustan Zinc are higher by around 1.5 percent in trade after a 3.9 percent surge a day before, with Vedanta's shares too sharply off early lows. In the past five trading session, shares of Goldiam International, a jewellery exporter, are higher by over 11 percent. The rally in silver has followed the surge in gold prices, which topped $3,500 per ounce - a record high - on rising hopes of a rate cut by US Federal Reserve, and strong safe haven buying amid global uncertainties. So far this year, silver prices have soared more than 40 percent. Lower borrowing cost in US is expected to benefit precious metals. The recent, sharp weakness in Rupee, testing record low of 88/USD too is likely to benefit major exporters' earnings. Fund flow into silver ETFs too have strengthened recently, with Nippon’s India silver ETF crossing Rs 10,000 crore AUM mark, tracking global momentum and domestic demand projections ahead of the festive season. Globally, silver ETF holdings have grown for a seventh consecutive month in August, the longest run since 2020. One of key beneficiaries, Hindustan Zinc is the world's third largest silver producer with an output of 687 MT of silver in FY25, and a planned target to ramp up capacity to 1500 MT by 2030. The management sees silver prices staying buoyant in the coming quarters, with its precious metal portfolio contributing significantly to the overall profitability. Hindustan Zinc has also announced India’s first zinc tailings reprocessing plant at an investment of Rs 3,823 crore to recover high-value zinc and silver from discarded material.
summary_lexrank: Hindustan Zinc has also announced India’s first zinc tailings reprocessing plant at an investment of Rs 3,823 crore to recover high-value zinc and silver from discarded material.
summary_luhn: Last month alone, silver prices surged over 10 percent, and the continued rally has rubbed off on the shares of Indian companies engaged in related businesses such as Hindustan Zinc, Vedanta and Goldiam International, anticipating earnings boost from a surge in industrial as well as investor demand.
summary_lsa: In the past five trading session, shares of Goldiam International, a jewellery exporter, are higher by over 11 percent.

title: Peterhouse Investments Reduces Stake in Usha Martin to 1.90%
content: Peterhouse Investments India Ltd disclosed its shareholding in Usha Martin Limited on August 29, 2025, in compliance with SEBI SAST Regulations, 2011. Prior to the transaction, Peterhouse Investments held 5,966,529 equity shares, representing 1.95% of the total share/voting capital of Usha Martin. The firm executed a sale of 150,000 equity shares through the open market on the National Stock Exchange on August 28, 2025. This reduced its stake to 5,816,529 shares, now equivalent to 1.90% of the total share/voting capital. Usha Martin's equity share capital/total voting capital remains unchanged at 30,47,41,780 before and after the reported transaction. Total diluted share/voting capital post-transaction remains at 30,47,41,780.

title: J. K. Cement share price falls 2.22% in today's trading
content: Shares of J. K. Cement declined 2.22% to Rs 6,910.50 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, trading lower at 12:19 pm. On the financial front, J. K. Cement has demonstrated consistent growth in recent years. The company's consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily, reaching Rs 11,879.15 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 11,556.00 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit also saw an increase, with Rs 871.58 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 789.93 Crore in the previous year. Here's a summary of J. K. Cement's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 2025Rs 11,879.15Rs 871.58111.44788.0114.140.97Mar 2024Rs 11,556.00Rs 789.93102.35688.7114.730.98Mar 2023Rs 9,720.20Rs 419.0855.17600.819.091.07Mar 2022Rs 7,990.82Rs 679.4287.90555.2915.880.89Mar 2021Rs 6,606.10Rs 703.1090.99480.2818.990.84The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased by 2.79% compared to the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 also increased by 10.34% compared to the year-ending March 2024. The quarterly performance shows a similar trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,352.53 Crore, up from Rs 2,807.57 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 324.24 Crore, compared to Rs 184.82 Crore in the previous year.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 2025Rs 3,352.53Rs 324.2441.99Mar 2025Rs 3,581.18Rs 361.3946.54Dec 2024Rs 2,930.28Rs 189.2224.54Sep 2024Rs 2,560.12Rs 136.1516.28Jun 2024Rs 2,807.57Rs 184.8223.98The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 increased by 19.41% compared to the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 increased significantly by 75.43% compared to the quarter-ending June 2024. J. K. Cement announced a final dividend of Rs 15.00 per share with an effective date of July 8, 2025. Earlier announcements include a final dividend of Rs 15.00 per share and a special dividend of Rs 5.00 per share, both with an effective date of July 9, 2024. According to a Moneycontrol analysis as of August 26, 2025, the sentiment for J. K. Cement is neutral. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 6,910.50, J. K. Cement has seen a decline in today's session.

Recent announcements include newspaper publications under Regulation 30 (LODR) on August 26, 2025, and August 21, 2025. Additionally, a notice was issued to shareholders regarding the transfer of equity shares to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF) Account on August 19, 2025. The company has also announced several interim dividends:July 31, 2025: Rs 5.00 per share (500%), effective August 13, 2025April 21, 2025: Rs 5.00 per share (500%), effective May 13, 2025January 8, 2025: Rs 5.00 per share (500%), effective February 3, 2025October 14, 2024: Rs 5.00 per share (500%), effective October 31, 2024July 22, 2024: Rs 5.00 per share (500%), effective August 16, 2024The company has also issued bonus shares. On July 30, 2018, bonus shares were issued in the ratio of 1:2, with an ex-bonus date of September 12, 2018. On May 9, 2017, bonus shares were issued in the ratio of 1:1, with an ex-bonus date of June 22, 2017. Godrej Consumer Products had a rights issue announced on November 23, 2007, with a rights ratio of 1:7. The ex-rights date was March 12, 2008. The company had a stock split on April 26, 2006, with an ex-split date of August 24, 2006. The face value changed from Rs 4 to Rs 1.Market SentimentAs per Moneycontrol analysis, the market sentiment for Godrej Consumer Products is very bullish as of September 2, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,282.50, Godrej Consumer Products has shown a positive movement, reflecting investor confidence and a bullish market sentiment.

title: Buy Phoenix Mills; target of Rs 2044: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Phoenix Mills During FY15-25, PHNX’s retail portfolio witnessed an 11% CAGR in consumption, supported by ~7% like-for-like growth in the existing malls and the opening of new malls in Lucknow, Indore, Ahmedabad, Pune, and Bengaluru. Additionally, retail rental income clocked a similar 12% CAGR during this period, mirroring the consumption growth. We anticipate this positive growth trend to continue, primarily driven by the ramp-up of new malls. As of 1QFY26, trading occupancy stood at 89%, down from 91% in Mar’25. Flat or declining consumption in certain mature assets is linked to ongoing revamps and tenant churn. In Bengaluru, approximately 10% of the leasable area is currently under fit-outs or being repurposed from hypermarkets to high-performing fashion anchors. Pune is undergoing a similar transformation, replacing outdated anchors and restaurants with newer, more relevant offerings. Management remains optimistic about the long-term performance, projecting strong growth from FY27 onward once the revamps are completed. Outlook We upgrade our rating to BUY with a revised TP of INR2,044 (earlier INR1,673), implying upside potential of 35%. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Phoenix Mills - 02092025 - moti

title: Infosys shares trade down marginally; touches day's high of Rs 1,503
content: Shares of Infosys were trading down marginally in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,497.90. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,503 and a day's low of Rs 1,486.30 at 11:30 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Infosys's financial performance reveals the following trends:Revenue: The company’s consolidated revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. For the year ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 162,990 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024 and Rs 146,767 Crore in March 2023.Net Profit: The net profit has also increased steadily, reaching Rs 26,750 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024 and Rs 24,108 Crore in March 2023.Earnings Per Share (EPS): The EPS has risen from Rs 45.61 in 2021 to Rs 64.50 in 2025, reflecting enhanced profitability per share.The following table shows the consolidated financial performance of Infosys:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 162,990 CroreRs 153,670 CroreRs 146,767 CroreRs 121,641 CroreRs 100,472 CroreNet ProfitRs 26,750 CroreRs 26,248 CroreRs 24,108 CroreRs 22,146 CroreRs 19,423 CroreEPSRs 64.50Rs 63.39Rs 57.63Rs 52.52Rs 45.61BVPSRs 231.11Rs 212.74Rs 183.17Rs 180.50Rs 180.75ROE27.87%29.77%31.95%29.34%25.34%Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Earlier, on July 13, 2018, the company had announced a bonus issue with existing ratio of 1:1, ex-bonus date being September 4, 2018. At 11:30 am, Infosys was trading close to its day's high, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,497.90.

title: Max Healthcare Institute shares decline 1.77% amid volume surge
content: Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited experienced a decline of 1.77% to trade at Rs 1,160.30 in Tuesday's session, amidst high volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at the consolidated financial performance of Max Healthcare Institute Limited: Consolidated Quarterly Performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,542.95 CroreRs 1,707.46 CroreRs 1,868.31 CroreRs 1,909.74 CroreRs 2,027.57 CroreNet ProfitRs 236.27 CroreRs 281.81 CroreRs 238.80 CroreRs 319.00 CroreRs 307.97 CroreEPS2.432.902.463.283.17The company's revenue has shown consistent growth over the quarters. Revenue increased from Rs 1,542.95 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 2,027.57 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also saw fluctuations but remained generally strong, with a peak of Rs 319.00 Crore in March 2025. The EPS has mirrored this trend, with the highest value of Rs 3.28 in March 2025. Consolidated Yearly Performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,504.67 CroreRs 3,931.46 CroreRs 4,562.60 CroreRs 5,406.02 CroreRs 7,028.46 CroreNet Profit-114.50 Crore605.05 Crore1,103.51 Crore1,057.64 Crore1,075.88 CroreEPS-1.596.2511.3810.8911.07BVPS58.3764.7976.3186.5196.50ROE-2.439.6314.8912.5711.46Debt to Equity0.160.120.080.140.27The yearly data reveals a strong turnaround from a net loss in 2021 to consistent profits in subsequent years. Revenue has also grown substantially year-over-year. In 2025, the revenue increased by 29.99% compared to 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio has increased from 0.14 in 2024 to 0.27 in 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Another final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share was announced on May 22, 2024, with an effective date of August 23, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 28, 2025, suggests a very bearish sentiment on the stock. The stock's last traded price was Rs 1,160.30, and Moneycontrol analysis suggests a very bearish sentiment.

title: DLF shares rise 2.02%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: DLF's stock showed positive movement in Tuesday's session, with the share price rising by 2.02% to Rs 763.45. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50 index as of 11:43 am. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide a summary of DLF's financial performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,362.35 CroreRs 1,975.02 CroreRs 1,528.71 CroreRs 3,127.58 CroreRs 2,716.70 CroreNet ProfitRs 339.28 CroreRs 1,043.41 CroreRs 440.40 CroreRs 871.42 CroreRs 382.12 CroreEPS2.615.584.285.183.08The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,716.70 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 1,362.35 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 382.12 Crore, up from Rs 339.28 Crore in the previous year. title: Endurance Technologies share price falls 3.22%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Endurance Technologies were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index on Tuesday, September 02, 2025. At 11:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 2,845.20, a decline of 3.22% from its previous close. Motilal Oswal and UPL were also among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, declining 2.32% and 2.27% respectively. Other stocks that experienced losses included Tube Investment (1.62%) and AU Small Financ (1.6%).Endurance Technologies Financial PerformanceEndurance Technologies has demonstrated consistent growth in its financial performance over the past five years. The company's consolidated revenue has increased steadily, reaching Rs 11,560.81 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 6,547.02 Crore in 2021. Net profit has also seen significant growth, rising from Rs 519.57 Crore in 2021 to Rs 836.35 Crore in 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) has improved from Rs 36.95 in 2021 to Rs 59.46 in 2025, reflecting enhanced profitability and efficiency. Here is a table summarizing the key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,547.02519.5736.95253.2414.580.1220227,549.14460.7132.75278.6811.750.1020238,804.05479.5834.09313.6710.860.11202410,240.87680.4948.38353.8613.670.15202511,560.81836.3559.46406.4614.620.16The quarterly financial performance also reflects strong revenue and net profit. For the quarter ending June 2025, the company reported revenue of Rs 3,318.89 Crore and a net profit of Rs 226.35 Crore, with an EPS of Rs 16.09.Endurance Technologies Corporate ActionsEndurance Technologies Limited has been actively involved in investor communications and capacity enhancements. Key recent announcements include:Newspaper advertisements published on August 26, 2025, in the Financial Express and Loksatta, providing public notice under the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority's "Saksham Niveshak" campaign.Capacity addition for anti-lock braking systems, disc brake systems, and brake discs.Multiple investor meets scheduled on September 2, 2025, from 10:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.The company declared a final dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (100%) on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of August 01, 2025. Prior dividends include Rs 8.50 per share in 2024, Rs 7.00 per share in 2023, Rs 6.25 per share in 2022 and Rs 6.00 per share in 2021. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,845.20, Endurance Techn was among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Exide Industries shares rise 2.05% in today's trading
content: Shares of Exide Industries saw a rise of 2.05% to Rs 420.70 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On August 30, 2025, there was an announcement regarding changes in the company's management and the appointment of directors. Additionally, there was an announcement on August 29, 2025, regarding the closure of the trading window. Exide Industries has consistently provided dividends. A final dividend of Rs 2 per share was announced on April 30, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Similar final dividends were announced on April 30, 2024 (effective July 22, 2024), and May 8, 2023 (effective August 1, 2023). The company also issued an interim dividend of Rs 2 per share on January 10, 2022 (effective February 7, 2022) and January 12, 2021 (effective February 4, 2021). The company has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent one on April 25, 2003, in the ratio of 1:1. Other bonus issues were announced on June 23, 1987 (3:5), June 23, 1983 (3:5), June 23, 1980 (1:4), and June 23, 1977 (3:8). Exide Industries also had rights issues, including one on August 28, 2007, with a ratio of 1:15 at a premium of Rs 29. Further rights issues were announced on February 17, 1998 (1:4, premium of Rs 90) and March 26, 1995 (1:5, premium of Rs 40). A stock split was announced on June 16, 2006, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 1, effective September 8, 2006. title: Tube Investments of India shares fall over 2% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd declined 2.20% to Rs 3,071.70 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Quarterly Financials: The consolidated revenue for Tube Investments of India Ltd has shown a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, up from Rs 5,149.96 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 303.28 Crore. Key quarterly financial data is presented below:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,577.92 CroreRs 4,924.55 CroreRs 4,812.22 CroreRs 5,149.96 CroreRs 5,309.06 CroreNet ProfitRs 313.80 CroreRs 299.30 CroreRs 280.22 CroreRs 158.22 CroreRs 303.28 CroreEPS11.6410.6910.012.4110.28 Annual Financials: The consolidated annual revenue for Tube Investments of India Ltd has increased steadily over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 19,464.65 Crore, compared to Rs 16,890.33 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,054.67 Crore. The following table presents key annual financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,083.29 CroreRs 12,525.30 CroreRs 14,964.73 CroreRs 16,890.33 CroreRs 19,464.65 CroreNet ProfitRs 304.69 CroreRs 994.31 CroreRs 1,177.98 CroreRs 1,187.51 CroreRs 1,054.67 CroreEPS15.1339.8949.5062.1234.83BVPS130.07193.12256.63348.74286.08ROE13.1825.0324.1823.5412.17Debt to Equity0.610.260.160.150.08 Annual Income Statement: The total income for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,835 Crore, while the total expenditure was Rs 18,118 Crore. The EBIT stood at Rs 1,717 Crore. The annual sales has increased by approximately 15% from March 2024 to March 2025. Quarterly Income Statement: For the quarter-ending June 2025, the total income was Rs 5,380 Crore and total expenditure was Rs 4,914 Crore. The EBIT for the same period stood at Rs 465 Crore. Balance Sheet: As of March 2025, Tube Investments of India Ltd reported total liabilities of Rs 15,964 Crore and total assets of Rs 15,964 Crore. The company's fixed assets amounted to Rs 4,730 Crore, and current assets were Rs 9,429 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,213 Crore. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs 1,615 Crore, while financing activities provided a cash inflow of Rs 522 Crore. Financial Ratios: The basic EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 34.83, and diluted EPS was Rs 34.80. The book value per share (excluding revaluation reserve) was Rs 286.08. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.08 as of March 2025. The P/E ratio stood at 79.51 and P/B (x) was 9.69 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Tube Investments of India Ltd announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) was announced on February 3, 2025, with an effective date of February 7, 2025. Tube Investments of India Ltd has informed the Exchange about General Updates - ESG Ratings by CRISIL ESG Ratings & Analytics Limited on August 19, 2025. The ESG Rating assigned by CRISIL ESG Ratings & Analytics Limited on August 19, 2025. The stock's movement occurred at 11:31 am.

title: M&M shares fall 0.71%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of M&M were trading lower in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index, with the share price declining by 0.71% to Rs 3,291.90 at 11:30 am. Among other stocks that were the top losers on Nifty 50 were Dr Reddys Labs (down 0.66%), UltraTechCement (down 0.54%), Maruti Suzuki (down 0.45%), and Asian Paints (down 0.43%). Here is a detailed look into the financial performance of M&M: Financial Performance: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial data for M&M:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 37,217.72 CroreRs 37,923.74 CroreRs 41,470.05 CroreRs 42,599.31 CroreRs 45,529.19 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,221.34 CroreRs 2,894.71 CroreRs 3,317.22 CroreRs 3,102.48 CroreRs 3,898.44 CroreEPS29.4428.4328.5129.5236.58The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 45,529.19 Crore, which is an increase compared to Rs 37,217.72 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,898.44 Crore, compared to Rs 3,221.34 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for the same period increased to 36.58 from 29.44. Similarly, the net profit has also increased, with Rs 12,535.75 Crore reported in 2025 compared to Rs 2,425.26 Crore in 2021. EPS has risen from 16.33 in 2021 to 115.91 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained relatively stable, fluctuating slightly around 1.5. Dividends: M&M has a history of distributing dividends to its shareholders. The most recent final dividend was announced on May 5, 2025, at Rs 25.30 per share. Bonus Issues: The company has issued bonus shares on several occasions, with the most recent being a 1:1 bonus on November 10, 2017. Rights Issues: M&M had a rights issue on September 30, 1992, with an existing ratio of 5:1. Stock Splits: The company had a stock split on January 25, 2010, where the face value was split from Rs 10 to Rs 5. M&M's recent announcements include a dilution of stake in Mahindra Last Mile Mobility Limited and analyst/investor meet intimations. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,291.90, M&M has seen a slight decline in today's session and is among the top losers on the Nifty 50.

title: Power Grid Corp among top gainers on Nifty 50; stock rises 2.57%
content: Shares of Power Grid Corp were up 2.57% to Rs 287.05 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 11:30 am. This increase reflects a positive movement from its previous close. Financial Highlights: The company has demonstrated steady financial performance over the past few years. Here’s a look at some key figures: Consolidated Quarterly Data:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 11,006.18 CroreRs 11,277.76 CroreRs 11,233.03 CroreRs 12,275.35 CroreRs 11,196.22 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,694.90 CroreRs 3,897.63 CroreRs 3,866.72 CroreRs 4,172.45 CroreRs 3,675.02 CroreEPS4.004.084.154.463.90The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,275.35 Crore, which decreased to Rs 11,196.22 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. The net profit also saw a decrease from Rs 4,172.45 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 3,675.02 Crore in June 2025. The EPS decreased from 4.46 in March 2025 to 3.90 in June 2025. Consolidated Yearly Data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 39,639.79 CroreRs 41,616.34 CroreRs 45,581.28 CroreRs 45,843.10 CroreRs 45,792.32 CroreNet ProfitRs 11,821.76 CroreRs 16,745.60 CroreRs 15,499.24 CroreRs 15,592.71 CroreRs 15,631.70 CroreEPS23.0124.1222.1017.3616.69BVPS133.68109.31119.0193.7099.63ROE17.2122.0618.5717.8716.75Debt to Equity1.871.771.521.421.41The annual revenue saw a slight decrease from Rs 45,843.10 Crore in 2024 to Rs 45,792.32 Crore in 2025. Net profit increased marginally from Rs 15,592.71 Crore in 2024 to Rs 15,631.70 Crore in 2025. The EPS decreased from 17.36 in 2024 to 16.69 in 2025. involved in various corporate actions. Recent announcements include changes in senior management and being declared a successful bidder under TBCB. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.25 per share (12.5%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of August 19, 2025. Additionally, a second interim dividend of Rs 3.25 per share (32.5%) was announced on January 28, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. The company had also announced bonus issues, including a bonus ratio of 1:3 announced on July 31, 2023, with the ex-bonus date on September 12, 2023, and another one with bonus ratio of 1:3 announced on June 17, 2021, with the ex-bonus date on July 29, 2021. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 287.05, Power Grid Corp has shown a strong performance as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: Bosch shares hit all-time high, up 0.67%; stock part of Nifty Next 50
content: shares of Bosch touched an all-time high of Rs 41,356.95 on the BSE on Tuesday. At 11:20 am, the stock was trading at Rs 41,060, a gain of 0.67% and is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following tables present Bosch's key financial data: Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,316.80 CroreRs 4,394.30 CroreRs 4,465.70 CroreRs 4,910.60 CroreRs 4,788.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 465.40 CroreRs 535.90 CroreRs 458.10 CroreRs 553.60 CroreRs 1,115.30 CroreEPS158.09181.99155.53187.66378.41The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,788.60 Crore, compared to Rs 4,316.80 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,115.30 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 465.40 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the EPS for June 2025 was Rs 378.41, a notable increase from Rs 158.09 in June 2024. Consolidated Yearly Results:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,716.20 CroreRs 11,781.60 CroreRs 14,929.30 CroreRs 16,727.10 CroreRs 18,087.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 480.70 CroreRs 1,217.00 CroreRs 1,424.30 CroreRs 2,490.20 CroreRs 2,013.00 CroreEPS163.00413.00483.32844.68683.25BVPS3,326.413,620.273,730.544,087.084,682.47ROE4.9111.4012.9520.6614.58Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's annual revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 18,087.40 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 9,716.20 Crore in March 2021. However, net profit decreased to Rs 2,013.00 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 2,490.20 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also saw a decrease from 844.68 in March 2024 to 683.25 in March 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased to Rs 4,682.47 in March 2025, from Rs 3,326.41 in March 2021. The return on equity (ROE) stood at 14.58% for March 2025, compared to 20.66% for March 2024. The company maintained a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 over the observed period. title: Sun TV shares surge 6% as Avendus upgrades stock to "buy" on strong IPL growth outlook
content: Shares of Sun TV Network rallied 6 percent to Rs 581 apiece on September 2 after brokerage firm Avendus Spark turned bullish on the stock for the first time in five years. The brokerage upgraded Sun TV to “buy” from “sell” and significantly raised its price target to Rs 680 for the next 12 months and Rs 840 over the next three years. These targets imply an upside potential of 25 percent in the short term and 54 percent over the long term. Avendus Spark said it now views Sun TV as a fast-growing sports company rather than a stagnating linear TV broadcaster. It highlighted that Sun TV has the highest listed exposure to the Indian Premier League (IPL) among media peers, making it the purest proxy for investors to participate in India’s sports monetisation opportunity. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The brokerage expects Sun TV’s IPL revenue to grow at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 9 to 12 percent between 2025 and 2027, reaching Rs 15,000 crore. Its IPL franchise, Sunrisers Hyderabad, is projected to contribute nearly 60 percent to the company’s sum-of-the-parts (SOTP) valuation. Avendus Spark has applied a 40x price-to-earnings multiple to Sun TV’s IPL business and 10x to its core broadcasting business. In a strategic move to expand its sports portfolio, Sun TV’s board in July approved the acquisition of a 100 percent stake in Northern Superchargers Ltd., a London-based cricket franchise that competes in The Hundred, a professional league run by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). The deal is valued at £100.5 million (approximately Rs 1,161 crore). Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: National Aluminium Company shares surge 3.03% amid high volume
content: Shares of National Aluminium Company experienced a surge of 3.03% in Tuesday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 197.60. The stock demonstrated high and unusual trading volume during the session, also triggering a jump in volume. In terms of financial performance, National Aluminium Company has shown substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,806.94 Crore, compared to Rs 2,856.10 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,063.86 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 601.22 Crore in the previous year. The annual net profit also saw substantial growth, reaching Rs 5,324.67 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 2,059.95 Crore in the previous year. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 9,950 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 7,194 Crore. After accounting for interest (Rs 58 Crore) and tax (Rs 1,810 Crore), the net profit stood at Rs 5,324 Crore. The company’s cash flow statement indicates that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 5,806 Crore, from investing activities was -Rs 3,970 Crore, and from financing activities was -Rs 1,757 Crore. The net cash flow was Rs 77 Crore. The balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the share capital was Rs 918 Crore and reserves & surplus was Rs 16,887 Crore. Key financial ratios for March 2025 include a basic and diluted EPS of Rs 28.68, and a book value per share of Rs 96.95. The company's dividend per share was Rs 10.50, with a face value of Rs 5. Margin ratios showed a gross profit margin of 47.01%, an operating margin of 42.85%, and a net profit margin of 31.71%. Return ratios included a return on net worth/equity of 29.58%, ROCE of 37.11%, and return on assets of 23.02%. Liquidity ratios showed a current ratio of 2.61 and a quick ratio of 2.07. Leverage ratios indicated a debt to equity ratio of 0.01 and interest coverage ratio of 133.85. In corporate action news, National Aluminium Company Limited was imposed a fine of Rs. 7,51,660 by NSE, according to information shared with the exchange. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) on August 7, 2025, with an effective date of September 19, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (80%) was announced on February 10, 2025, effective February 14, 2025. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of August 26, 2025, the sentiment towards National Aluminium Company is bearish. Shares of National Aluminium Company experienced a notable surge in today's session, accompanied by high trading volume and significant financial growth.

title: ACME Solar Exits 300 MW Project, Collects EMD as Flexibility Scheme Becomes Voluntary
content: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project. PFC Consulting Limited (PFCCL), the bid coordinator, communicated the decision following the Ministry of Power's directive on January 21, 2025, which made participation in the Flexibility Scheme voluntary. The decision also follows a writ petition filed before the Delhi High Court by West Bengal State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (WBSEDCL), challenging provisions of the scheme; the matter remains sub judice. The Letter of Award, initially disclosed on February 6, 2024, concerned a 300 MW solar project at a tariff of ₹2.53/kWh under the Flexibility Scheme, with ACME Sigma Urja Private Limited as the project SPV. The Flexibility Scheme, introduced on April 12, 2022, aimed to introduce flexibility in the generation and scheduling of thermal/hydro power stations by bundling with renewable and storage energy. ACME Solar stated the project is currently generating no revenue or profitability, resulting in no material impact on the Company's financial performance.
summary_lexrank: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project.
summary_luhn: The Letter of Award, initially disclosed on February 6, 2024, concerned a 300 MW solar project at a tariff of ₹2.53/kWh under the Flexibility Scheme, with ACME Sigma Urja Private Limited as the project SPV.
summary_lsa: ACME Solar (Symbol: ACMESOLAR) announced it has received confirmation to exit a Letter of Award (LoA) without penalty, securing the return of its Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) for a 300 MW solar project.
summary_textrank: The Letter of Award, initially disclosed on February 6, 2024, concerned a 300 MW solar project at a tariff of ₹2.53/kWh under the Flexibility Scheme, with ACME Sigma Urja Private Limited as the project SPV.

title: Manappuram, IIFL Finance, other gold financier stocks rise up to 3% as precious metal hits lifetime high
content: Gold financier stocks extended gains on September 2, as the yellow metal continued to trade at lifetime high levels. Gold futures have crossed the key Rs 1.05 lakh per 10 grams-mark on MCX. The rising gold prices bodes well for gold financiers, as it increases the value of the collateral while issuing loans. This reduces the risk of default, as the collateral becomes more valuable relative to the loan amount issued against it. Manappuram Finance shares gained nearly 3 percent to trade at around Rs 282 apiece, nearing a record high level after extending gains for the second consecutive session. The stock has now gained more than 8 percent in two days. IIFL Finance shares gained nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 447.50 apiece, also extending gains for the second day. Muthoot Finance shares meanwhile gained over 2 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 2,768 apiece. Gold futures with October expiry on the MCX hit an all-time high of Rs 1,05,937 per 10 grams yesterday. The contracts are hovering near the record high level today. This comes amid heightened global uncertainties. A weaker dollar and growing expectations for a U.S. interest rate cut this month are supporting the rising gold prices, said Manav Modi, Analyst – Precious Metal -Research, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Analyst expect the bull run in gold prices to continue. "A softer US dollar and renewed safe-haven demand supported the rally, as investors turned to gold amid ongoing uncertainty surrounding US monetary policy. Growing political pressure may accelerate the timeline for interest rate cuts, with markets largely pricing in a 25 bps reduction in September—a development that remains supportive for bullion," said Axis Securities. Manav Modi from Motilal Oswal Financial Services also noted that the precious metals were up on safe-haven buying. "Along with increasing rate cut expectations, tensions between Israel and Gaza and other geo-political tensions and the tariff escalations are continuously supporting buying in bullions, as increased expectations of a U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cut this month lifted bullion's allure…Increase in festive and wedding demand, ETF buying and Increased premiums in China are some of the additional factors supporting gold’s bull run," he added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Accumulate Hindustan Unilever; target of Rs 2870: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Hindustan Unilever HUL’s Q1FY26 performance was mixed, as revenue was broadly in line with our estimates; however, EBITDA stood below our estimates (-2.8%) led by elevated operating costs, while net profit stood above our expectations (+5.7%), led by oneoff i.e., lower ETR. Consolidated revenue grew at a moderate pace of 5.1% YoY (+5.4% QoQ) to INR 1,65,140 Mn., in-line with our estimates. The growth was led by underlying volume growth (UVG) of 4.0%, driven by broad-based USG (underlying sales growth) across segments including Beauty and Wellbeing, Personal Care, Foods, and Home Care. Outlook We have roll-forwarded our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Hindustan Unilever at 55.0x Jun’27 EPS (~to its 3-year Avg. NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 2,870. We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock, led by anticipated recovery in gross margin and enhanced competitive intensity through the remainder of FY26E. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Hindustan Unilever - 02092025 - deven

title: UPL share price falls 2.01% in today's session
content: Shares of UPL declined by 2.01% to Rs 713.35 in Tuesday's trading session, as of 10:59 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, UPL's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,216 Crore, compared to Rs 9,067 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 194 Crore for the same period, against a loss of Rs 495 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company’s EPS stood at -Rs 1.98 in June 2025 as compared to -Rs 6.02 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 46,637 Crore, compared to Rs 43,098 Crore in March 2024. The company reported a net profit of Rs 1,292 Crore for the same period, against a loss of Rs 1,636 Crore in the previous year. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 9.85 in March 2025 as compared to -Rs 17.80 in March 2024.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 38,694.00 CroreRs 46,240.00 CroreRs 53,576.00 CroreRs 43,098.00 CroreRs 46,637.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,453.00 CroreRs 4,303.00 CroreRs 4,257.00 CroreRs -1,636.00 CroreRs 1,292.00 CroreEPS36.4045.8745.79-17.809.85BVPS282.27344.08432.57330.76367.46ROE16.0316.7213.29-4.833.07Debt to Equity1.321.190.861.150.81The table illustrates UPL's financial performance over the past five years. Revenue has fluctuated, with a notable increase from Rs 38,694.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 46,637.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit saw a significant turnaround, recovering to Rs 1,292.00 Crore in 2025 after a loss of Rs -1,636.00 Crore in 2024. EPS followed a similar trend, rising to Rs 9.85 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 282.27 in 2021 to Rs 367.46 in 2025, while the return on equity (ROE) improved to 3.07 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has decreased to 0.81 in 2025. The company announced final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 12, 2025 with effective date as July 11, 2025. Earlier, the company had announced bonus issue on May 17, 2019, with existing ratio of 2 and offered ratio of 1 with ex-bonus date as July 02, 2019. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock as of today. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 713.35, UPL has seen a decline from its previous close.

title: Steel Authority of India shares rise 2.13%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Steel Authority of India gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 123.67 on Tuesday. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:58 am. On the financial front, Steel Authority of India's consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 25,921.76 Crore, compared to Rs 23,997.81 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 671.48 Crore, a significant rise from a net loss of Rs 24.87 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 1.80 in June 2025, up from Rs 0.20 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 102,479.06 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 105,378.33 Crore recorded in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,885.02 Crore, a decrease from Rs 2,628.06 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 5.74 for the year ending March 2025, down from Rs 7.42 in March 2024. Key financial ratios include a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.51 as of March 2025. The P/E ratio stood at 20.07 and the P/B ratio was 0.81 as of March 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 202169,113.613,680.3910.04109.939.130.78Mar 2022103,476.8411,825.3529.64131.2522.580.25Mar 2023104,447.721,530.865.27132.543.970.47Mar 2024105,378.332,628.067.42138.245.370.54Mar 2025102,479.061,885.025.74142.614.020.51The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.60 per share, which will be effective from September 9, 2025. A Moneycontrol analysis on August 28, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for the stock. Shares of Steel Authority of India gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 123.67 on Tuesday and is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Gokaldas Exports, Avanti Feeds rise up to 7% on US Treasury Secy's 'two great countries will get it solved' remark
content: Textile and shrimp stocks surged on September 2 after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed confidence that Washington and New Delhi can resolve the ongoing trade jitters, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned from China after attending the SCO Summit. Speaking to Fox News, Bessent said, "I think at the end of the day, two great countries will get this solved." He said the slow progress in India-US trade talks was one of the reasons behind US President Donald Trump-led US administration's decision to raise tariffs. He however criticised India's imports of Russian oil, which he said might be fueling Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine. "The Indians have not been great actors in terms of buying Russian oil and then reselling it, financing the Russian war effort in Ukraine," he said. Speaking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit, Bessent said it is largely performative. "I think at the end of the day, India is the most populous democracy in the world. Their values are much closer to ours and to China's than to Russia's," he added. Bessent's remarks may have spurred trade talk hopes between India and US, triggering a rally in the export-oriented textile and shrimp stocks. Gokaldas Exports shares jumped nearly 5 percent to trade at Rs 733 apiece, while KPR Mill shares surged nearly 3 percent. Raymond Lifestyle shares gained more than 3 percent, while Arvind Fashions sharers rose nearly 3 percent. Avanti Feeds shares rallied around 7 percent, while Apex Frozen Foods shares jumped more than 4 percent. Notably, these companies derive a major portion of their revenue from US exports. These stocks earlier tumbled after US increased its tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent, the highest among its Asian peers. US President Donald Trump recently lashed out at India, calling the relationship between India and US "a totally one-sided disaster". In a post on Truth Social, Trump said, "What few people understand is that we do very little business with India, but they do a tremendous amount of business with us. In other words, they sell us massive amounts of goods, their biggest “client,” but we sell them very little … They have now offered to cut their Tariffs to nothing, but it’s getting late. They should have done so years ago." Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: US President Donald Trump recently lashed out at India, calling the relationship between India and US "a totally one-sided disaster".
summary_luhn: In a post on Truth Social, Trump said, "What few people understand is that we do very little business with India, but they do a tremendous amount of business with us.
summary_lsa: Speaking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit, Bessent said it is largely performative.
summary_textrank: Textile and shrimp stocks surged on September 2 after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed confidence that Washington and New Delhi can resolve the ongoing trade jitters, hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned from China after attending the SCO Summit.

title: Phoenix Mills stock rallies 5% as Motilal Oswal upgrades to buy, sees 35% upside
content: Shares of mall operator and real estate player The Phoenix Mills rallied nearly five percent in trade on Tuesday, September 2, after domestic brokerage Motilal Oswal upgraded the counter to 'buy,' citing a strong growth outlook. The broking house upgraded its rating on the stock, while hiking its target price to Rs 2,044, which indicated a 35 percent upside from current levels. At 9.55 a.m., shares of the firm were quoting Rs 1,583.7, higher by 4.4 percent. During FY15-25, Phoenix Mills' retail portfolio witnessed an 11 percent CAGR in consumption, supported by ~7 percent like-for-like growth in the existing malls and the opening of new malls in Lucknow, Indore, Ahmedabad, Pune, and Bengaluru. Additionally, retail rental income clocked a similar 12 percent CAGR during this period, mirroring the consumption growth. Going ahead, Motilal Oswal anticipates this positive growth trend to continue, primarily driven by the ramp-up of new malls. The brokerage estimated a 21 percent CAGR in retail rental income over FY25-27E to reach Rs 2,800 crore by FY27E and total income to reach Rs 3,900 crore. While new malls continue to ramp up well, the firm is implementing measures to accelerate consumption at mature malls. These initiatives, along with a further increase in trading occupancy, will help Phoenix Mills sustain healthy traction in consumption. Further, the company continues to diversify and expand its office portfolio within its existing mall properties across key locations. Notable developments include office spaces at malls in Bengaluru (1.2msf), Chennai (0.4msf), and Palladium Mumbai (1.1msf). "Additionally, newly launched malls in Pune (1.2msf) and Bengaluru (1.2msf) are also contributing to the growth of Phoenix Mills' office segment. These strategic expansions highlight the firm's commitment to increasing its office presence in high-demand urban areas," said Motilal Oswal. Motilal Oswal also said Phoenix Mills’ acquisition of the remaining 49 percent stake in Island Star Mall Developers (ISMDPL) will strengthen its premium retail portfolio and unlock long-term value. The deal is expected to be earnings-accretive from the first year, with further upside as rental income stabilizes and the 2.71 msf incremental FSI potential is developed over the medium term. Staggered payments over three years are likely to keep the net debt-to-equity ratio below 0.4x for the next two years. Follow our market blog to catch all the live updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: The brokerage estimated a 21 percent CAGR in retail rental income over FY25-27E to reach Rs 2,800 crore by FY27E and total income to reach Rs 3,900 crore.
summary_lsa: Motilal Oswal also said Phoenix Mills’ acquisition of the remaining 49 percent stake in Island Star Mall Developers (ISMDPL) will strengthen its premium retail portfolio and unlock long-term value.
summary_textrank: During FY15-25, Phoenix Mills' retail portfolio witnessed an 11 percent CAGR in consumption, supported by ~7 percent like-for-like growth in the existing malls and the opening of new malls in Lucknow, Indore, Ahmedabad, Pune, and Bengaluru.

title: Endurance Technologies, AU Small Finance stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Endurance Technologies, AU Small Finance, and Motilal Oswal shares were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:00 am on Tuesday. Endurance Techn's stock declined by 2.64% to Rs 2,862.20. AU Small Financ's stock fell by 2.04% to Rs 706.85. Motilal Oswal's stock decreased by 2.03% to Rs 877.20. Max Healthcare's stock slipped by 1.3% to Rs 1,165.80, while Sundaram Fin's stock went down by 1.23% to Rs 4,394.10. Endurance Technologies Limited informed the exchange on August 26, 2025, about newspaper advertisements published in the Financial Express (English) and the Loksatta (Marathi) regarding public notice under the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority's "Saksham Niveshak" campaign. The company also announced capacity addition for anti-lock braking system, disc brake systems, and brake discs on August 19, 2025. Multiple investor meets were scheduled for September 2, 2025, from 10:00 am to 4:30 pm. title: Godrej Properties shares rise 2.12% in morning trade
content: Shares of Godrej Properties gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 1,993.60 in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Godrej Properties has demonstrated substantial growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 434.56 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 625.59 Crore, resulting in an EPS of Rs 19.92. The company's annual performance also shows significant improvements. For the year-ending March 2025, the consolidated revenue reached Rs 4,922.84 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 3,035.62 Crore in March 2024. The net profit soared to Rs 1,507.83 Crore, up from Rs 719.32 Crore in the previous year, with the EPS rising to Rs 49.02 from Rs 26.09. Key financial metrics for Godrej Properties show a mix of growth and stability. The company's revenue has increased steadily over the past five years, with a substantial rise in net profit. The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.73 as of March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial data for Godrej Properties:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSBVPSROEDebt to Equity2021Rs 764.92 Crore-Rs 73.36 Crore-Rs 7.48Rs 299.33-2.270.542022Rs 1,824.88 CroreRs 539.28 CroreRs 12.68Rs 312.024.060.602023Rs 2,252.26 CroreRs 661.33 CroreRs 20.55Rs 334.056.160.692024Rs 3,035.62 CroreRs 719.32 CroreRs 26.09Rs 370.507.251.072025Rs 4,922.84 CroreRs 1,507.83 CroreRs 49.02Rs 574.828.080.73Godrej Properties announced several corporate actions, including analyst/investor meets and press releases. On August 25, 2025, the company informed the exchange regarding a press release. The company had a split in the past where Old FV was Rs 10 and New FV was Rs 5. The ex-split date was November 21, 2013 and record date was November 22, 2013. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,993.60, Godrej Properties has seen a rise of 2.12% in Tuesday's session.

title: HUDCO shares rise 2.06%; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of HUDCO gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 215.71 in today's session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, Housing & Urban Development Corp's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,937.31 Crore, compared to Rs 2,844.99 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025, and Rs 2,188.35 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 630.23 Crore, down from Rs 727.74 Crore in the previous quarter, but up from Rs 557.75 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3.15, compared to Rs 3.64 in the previous quarter and Rs 2.79 in the quarter-ending June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,188.35 CroreRs 2,517.72 CroreRs 2,760.23 CroreRs 2,844.99 CroreRs 2,937.31 CroreNet ProfitRs 557.75 CroreRs 688.62 CroreRs 735.03 CroreRs 727.74 CroreRs 630.23 CroreEPS2.793.443.673.643.15The company's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past few years. In 2025, the revenue was Rs 10,311.29 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 7,784.29 Crore in 2024. Similarly, the net profit has increased from Rs 2,116.74 Crore in 2024 to Rs 2,709.14 Crore in 2025. The EPS has also risen from Rs 10.57 in 2024 to Rs 13.53 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 7,234.58 CroreRs 6,954.08 CroreRs 7,049.46 CroreRs 7,784.29 CroreRs 10,311.29 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,578.58 CroreRs 1,716.60 CroreRs 1,701.62 CroreRs 2,116.74 CroreRs 2,709.14 CroreEPS7.898.578.5010.5713.53BVPS65.8872.2777.1482.9889.75ROE11.9611.8611.0112.7415.07Debt to Equity4.624.254.074.455.97HUDCO announced several corporate actions, including the cancellation of a Board Meeting scheduled for August 29, 2025, and the withdrawal of a Bond Allotment Committee Meeting, also planned for August 29, 2025. The company had previously announced on August 25, 2025, its compliance with regulations related to the issue of Non-Convertible Debt Securities. The company announced dividend of Rs 1.05 per share (10.5%) Final Dividend effective from September 8, 2025. On July 29, 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 1.15 per share (11.5%) was announced with effective date as August 14, 2025. Shares of HUDCO are trading positively today, with the stock currently priced at Rs 215.71.

title: Mobikwik shares jump 11% as ADIA fully exits stake via block deal
content: Shares of One Mobikwik Systems surged 11 percent to Rs 262 apiece on September 2 after key shareholder Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) exited its stake in the payments solutions provider via block deals a day earlier. According to block deal data on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), ADIA sold 16.44 lakh equity shares of Mobikwik at an average price of Rs 238.45 per share, taking the total deal value to Rs 39.21 crore. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The number of shares offloaded represents 2.1 percent of Mobikwik’s outstanding equity, which matches ADIA’s stake as per the June quarter shareholding pattern. Apart from ADIA, Peak XV Partners (9.92 percent), Cisco Systems (1.54 percent), and American Express Travel Related Services Company Inc. (1.34 percent) are among the prominent public shareholders in Mobikwik. Other foreign portfolio investors include Government Pension Fund Global (3.01 percent), Societe Generale (1.2 percent), and Citigroup Global Markets (1.12 percent). On the earnings front, Mobikwik reported a consolidated loss of Rs 41.9 crore for the June quarter, as its high-margin financial services business came under pressure amid ongoing strategic overhaul efforts. The company expects recovery and EBITDA breakeven by the second half of fiscal 2026. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 271.3 crore, down 20.7 percent from Rs 342.2 crore in Q1 FY25. Sequentially, losses narrowed from Rs 56 crore in Q4 FY25, while revenue saw a marginal uptick of 1.3 percent. Over the last month, Mobikwik shares have gained 12 percent, outperforming the flat-to-positive trend in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
